class optimizerHandler.BH_SCIPY(reader_obj, option_obj)

Bases: ScipyAlgorithmBasis

Implements the Basinhopping algorithm for minimization from the scipy package.

Parameters:

  • reader_obj – an instance of DATA object

  • option_obj – an instance of optionHandler object

See also

Documentation of the Simulated Annealing from ‘scipy’:

http://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy-dev/reference/generated/scipy.optimize.basinhopping.html

Performs the optimization.

class optimizerHandler.CEO_INSPYRED(reader_obj, option_obj)

Bases: InspyredAlgorithmBasis

Implements a custom version of Evolution Strategy algorithm for minimization from the inspyred package. :param reader_obj: an instance of DATA object :param option_obj: an instance of optionHandler object .. note:

The changed parameters compared to the defaults are the following:
        * replacer: genrational_replacement
        * variator: gaussian_mutation, blend_crossover

See also

Documentation of the options from ‘inspyred’:

http://inspyred.github.io/reference.html#module-inspyred.ec

class optimizerHandler.baseOptimizer(reader_obj, option_obj)

Bases: object

An abstract base class to implement the base of an optimization process.

SetFFun(option_obj)

Sets the combination function and converts the name of the fitness functions into function instances. :param option_obj: an optionHandler instance

class optimizerHandler.bounderObject(xmax, xmin)

Bases: object

Creates a callable to perform the bounding of the parameters. :param xmax: list of maxima :param xmin: list of minima

optimizerHandler.callback(c, x, y)
class optimizerHandler.grid(reader_obj, option_obj, resolution)

Bases: baseOptimizer

Implements a brute force algorithm for minimization by calculating the function’s value over the specified grid. .. note:

This algorithm is highly inefficient and should not be used for complete optimization.
Parameters:

  • reader_obj – an instance of DATA object

  • option_obj – an instance of optionHandler object

  • resolution – number of sample points along each dimensions (default: 10)

Optimize(optimals)

Performs the optimization.

optimizerHandler.uniform(random, args)

Creates random values from a uniform distribution. Used to create initial population.

Parameters:

  • random – random number generator object

  • args – dictionary, must contain key “num_params” and either “_ec” or “self”

Returns:

the created random values in a list
